metadata.title: CVE-2019-8696 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. Thisissue is fixed in macOS Mojave 10.14.6, Security Update 2019-004 HighSierra, Security Update 2019-004 Sierra. An attacker in a privilegednetwork position may be able to execute arbitrary code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-8696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cups - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-bsd - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-client - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-core-drivers - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-daemon - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-ipp-utils - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-ppdc - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
cups-server-common - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcups2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcupscgi1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcupsimage2 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcupsmime1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
libcupsppdc1 - 2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cups package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.7-1ubuntu2.7').
